intro: Santanderia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Santanderia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and compact growth habit. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
